page.title: 10FECKENHAM PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: Feckenham Parish council held its inaugural meeting on 23rd May 1983, with seven parish councillors having been elected on 5th May 1983. The annual precept received from Redditch Borough Council is raised by levying a 2p rate on households in the Parish, amounting to approximately Â£1,400. This money is used for the general running of the Parish Council,the services of a Clerk, election costs, amenity items,and also for grants to organisations in the Parish.The Parish Council is advised of, and able to comment on, all planning applications in the Parish, and acts as a voice for parishioners on any matters concerning the future development of the village.
